question: Who has been appointed the Governor of the Tamil-dominated Northern Province of Sri Lanka?
explanation: Sri Lankan spin legend Muttiah Muralitharan is likely to be governor of the countryâ€™s Tamil-dominated Northern Province after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa invited him to accept the post. The 47-year-old ace spinner, the record holder for highest wickets in Test cricket (800), is among the three new governors tipped to be appointed by Mr. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who registered a thumping victory in the November 16 presidential election.
